characters: A COMPLETELY BLACK SCREEN. THE FOLLOWING QUOTE IS SUPERE
LONG LENS OF THE CROWDED HALLWAY
THE PAPER MACHE ELM STREET HOUSE
CAMERA SLOWLY PULLS BACK, CRANING UP TO REVEAL
A JAR OF FOLGER'S COFFEE CRYSTALS

dialogues.speaker: A COMPLETELY BLACK SCREEN. THE FOLLOWING QUOTE IS SUPERE
dialogues.text: "Sleep.  Those little slices  of death.  How I loathe them."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warren Zevon's "I'll Sleep When I'm Dead" BLARES from a r we begin a CLOSUP MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: A YOUNG GIRL'S HAND
dialogues.text: dips a strip of newspaper into a bowl of paper mache mix.

dialogues.speaker: THE WETTED PAPER
dialogues.text: is applied to a paper mache surface, and a popsicle stick pressed into place.  (We are TOO TIGHT to see the object constructed.)

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN PARKER
dialogues.text: Kristen (16) is strikingly pretty, despite the dark, tire under her eyes.  She's exhausted, but desperately trying awake.  She wears pajamas and robe. Her head nods, her eyelids close.  She snaps herself awak

dialogues.speaker: THE RADIO
dialogues.text: She turns the VOLUME UP EVEN LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLOCK
dialogues.text: It's 1:20 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: A JAR OF FOLGER'S COFFEE CRYSTALS
dialogues.text: She scoops out a spoonful.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: She puts the spoonful of coffee crystals in her mouth and it down with a swig of Diet Coke.

dialogues.speaker: PAPER MACHE
dialogues.text: Another piece is applied.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Nodding off again.  She rouses herself angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom door opens and her mother enters.  ELAINE PAR 30's, is dressed in an expensive evening gown that carefu displays her assets.  She snaps the radio off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?  You'll wake the whole neighborhood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bleary-eyed) Hi Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't "hi Mom" me.  What are you still doing up?  It's past one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd wait for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening) Well, I'm home now, so you can go right to sleep.  C'mon, angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, I'm not tired.  Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning down the bed) Kristen, don't start with me.  You know what your shrink said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sullen) He's full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not going to let you get me into an argument, goddamn it.  Not tonight.  Now get in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen does as she's told.  Her mother goes to the door reaches for the light switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a soft plea) Mom?  I'm still having these awful dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN'S VOICE comes from downstairs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine?  Where do you keep the bourbon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right down! (to Kristen) Look honey, I've got a guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't want to keep him waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes, shutting Kristen into darkness.  She lie blinking back angry tears.  She turns on her side, her ga falling on:

dialogues.speaker: THE PAPER MACHE OBJECT
dialogues.text: It is a miniature house glowing weirdly in th moonlight. homemade replica of the Elm Street House.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Staring at the tiny house, hearing her mother's FAINT LAU downstairs. Kristen begins to nod off, though she's fighting it. A breeze starts up, rustling her hair.  Leaves fall acros pillow and face.  Her mother's LAUGHTER FADES OUT, replac EERIE GIGGLING of small children.  She awakes with a star

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA SLOWLY PULLS BACK, CRANING UP TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Kristen's bed sits in the middle of the dark, deserted st front of the Elm Street House. Small CHILDREN are playing on the lawn.  The boys are dre suits, the girls in party dresses.  They are jumping rope chanting a singsong:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, Freddy's coming for you,  three, four, better lock your door, five, six, grab your crucifix...

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: gets out of bed and approaches the children, transfixed. ...except for one eerily pretty LITTLE GIRL sitting on he tricycle near the front door, hair billowing in the breez stares at Kristen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen.  What's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Little Girl giggles and smiles shyly, but doesn't ans What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind kicks up, MOANING.  We hear the SOUND OF WIND CH

dialogues.speaker: THE WIND CHIME
dialogues.text: Tinkling in the wind.  The "chimes" are long razors.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door of the house CREAKS open behind the Little Darkness within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly) I have to go now.  Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RINGING the bell on the handlebar, she pedals her tricycl the door and is swallowed by the darkness inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Don't go in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.  Kristen stands alone.  Fighting her fear, she  approaches the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen enters.  The place is barren, empty.  Broken wind flaking paint, rotted walls.  Leaves skitter across teh f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little girl!

dialogues.speaker: THE CHILDREN
dialogues.text: They sense her presence and turn their vacant, staring ey her.  They scatter, vanishing into the shadows... She hears the JINGLING of the tricycle bell and the GIGGL the Little Girl ECHOING FAINTLY from deep inside the hous silence again.  Kristen tries to follow the sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen comes around a corner just in time to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quick glimpse of the Little Girl vanishing around the c the far end of a long, twisted corridor.  The walls are s with rust...or perhaps dried blood.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: She keeps following.  Being led.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen comes around a corner and finds herself facing a steel door that is just closing wiht a SOLID METALLIC CLA riveted metal seems out of place in the rotted wood house Kristen goes to the door and pulls it slowly open.  A sta leading down into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWAY
dialogues.text: Kristen carefully makes her way down the metal steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen fearfully enters Freddy's decrepit lair.  Ancient boilers stand cold and silent in the shadows. The SOFT JINGLE of the tricycle draws Kristen's attention

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Little Girl pedals out of the darkness and comes to a before Kristen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where he takes us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a SCREECH OF METAL.  Kristen whirls and sees:

dialogues.speaker: A BOILER
dialogues.text: The rusted furnace door is swinging open, metal grating o Inside, the charred bones of children lie in heaps of col tricycle lies in the carnage, identical to the Little Gir only charred.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Horrified.  Suddenly, a METAL DOOR SLAMS LOUDLY in the da THUDDING FOOTSTEPS approach, BOOMING CLOSER.

dialogues.speaker: THE LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: looks up at Kristen with sad eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eerily calm) Freddy's home.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOILER FURNACE
dialogues.text: Now alive with ROARING FLAMES.  The tricycle's paint bubb scorches in the intense heat.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: scoops the Little Girl into her arms and runs in blind te She glances back over her shoulder to see:

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: looming from the row of boilers, an indistinct silhouette hellish smoke and flames.  His maniacal LAUGHTER ECHOES t the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: ducks through a doorway into another room, still carrying Little Girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred teenage bodies hang from teh ceiling, strung up darkness like butchered meat.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: gazes in horror.  She looks down at the Little Girl cradl arms -- she is now a horribly charred, brittle corpse.  S her tiny mouth bursts open, emitting a ghastly, ear-split

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: As she sits bolt upright in bed, panting in terror, face sweat.  She looks around, recognizing her own room. She gets out of bed and walks unsteadily to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: She clicks on the light and looks at her reflection in th Still trembling, she runs water in the sink and splashes trying to calm down. The water becomes too hot.  Steam rises. She tries to turn the water off, but the pressure increas Steam.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: She fiddles with the handle, confused. As she turns it, the four-pronged handle suddenly springs grasping her hand.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: gasps and looks up.  Freddy's face grins out at her from mirror.  She SCREAMS.  Steam billows up.

dialogues.speaker: THE SINK
dialogues.text: The other faucet handle begins to flex and stretch, turni Freddy's claw hand.  Finger razors grow.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: SCREAMING, struggling to break free.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: leering from the mirror, laughing.  The claw hand rises u frame, poising to slash Kristen's exposed wrist.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: SCREAMING as the blades slash downward.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: Grinning as a spray of blood hits the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: bursts open, revealing Kristen's mother.  She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: No steam.  The mirror and sink are normal...except for th streaks of spattered blood. Kristen turns to her mother, slowly waking from her dream holds a bloody razor in her hand.  Her wrist is slashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed, weak) Mommy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isolated and somewhat gothic, it's an enormous multi-wing structure built by the Catholic Church in the 1920's.  A is centerpiece to several rambling wings.  Originally an asylum, it is now a modernized state-run facility.  An ir surrounds the sprawling grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLYING with MAX, the burly black Chief Orderly, as he m morning rounds.  He wheels a rolling cart containing a va medications down the hall.  A NEWSCASTER'S VOICE comes fr small portable radio dangling from the cart:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In local nows, two more teenage deaths have occurred -- both suicides.  County health officials are at a loss to explain this alarming trend --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimacing, Max switches to a music station as DOCTOR NEIL (early 30's), bright and intense, falls in step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absorbed in a clipboard of patient's charts) Nothing like a little cheery news to start  the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say listen, Doc.  I got a new theory about all these suicides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hold back on us, Max.  We need all the help we can get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucked up chromosomes, man.  Think about it.  Their parents all dropped acid in  the Sixties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It beats Dr. Simm's theory.  She thinks it's nothing but sex, drugs, and rock & roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, that's what keeps people alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max exits frame.  Neil continues on.  JENNIFER,  a girl o approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Doctor Goldman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She extends her hand for inspection -- it is scarred with cigarette burns.  She points to three different welts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Menthol, regular, ultra-light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're healing up nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been good.  When do I get cigarette priveleges back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hold your breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer shrugs.  It was worth a try.  She moves on. TARYN, a 17 year old blonde, approaches.  She appears exh dark tired circles under her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Taryn.  You don't look so hot, kid. Been getting any sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ignores him.  Neil watches her float past, then jots his clipboard. Didn't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil comes to the Quiet Room and peers through the small window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KINCAID, an enormous and powerful-looking 17 year old wit shaved head is huddled in the corner of the white padded gazing at nothing.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: makes a notation on his clipboard.  DOCTOR ELIZABETH SIMM hospital superior, appears at his elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooling down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he continues having these outbursts, I'll have to have him isolated permanently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it won't come to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit frome.  CAMERA PUSHES UP to teh mesh-grid windo Quiet Room for a shot of Kincaid.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: He stares into space, singing softly under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't gonna dream no more, no more, I ain't gonna dream no more.  All night long I sing this song, 'cause I ain't  gonna dream no more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read the report on our new staff  member.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, I don't understand why some grad school superstar is being treated like a seasoned pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been doing ground-breaking research on pattern nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, we don't need any outside help.  I know these kids.  I don't  want some hot-shot taking chances  with them just so she can get published.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms is about to say more, but is interrupted by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Goldman to Examination, stat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hurry down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: NURSES' STATION
dialogues.text: Kristen's mother, near hysteria, is loudly berating a NUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me that shit!  She's just  trying to get attention, that's all! I'm not playing her little game any- more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Simms rush past into the examination room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Simms burst into a chaotic struggle.  Kristen is berserk, fighting the STAFF as they try to restrain her a wrestle her onto a gurney -- the gurney goes crashing int wall.  A frantic NURSE addresses Neil:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suicide attempt.  They just brought her in from County General!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen Parker.  She was fine until we tried to sedate her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face contorted with terror, Kristen kicks and bites a scratches as ORDERLIES try to pin her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it!  She tore her stiches out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen, we want to help you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max enters and takes immediate control.  he shoves everyb of the way, spins Kristen effortlessly around, and pins h firmly from behind.  She tries to struggle, but he's too She weakens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (compassionate) Calm down, baby sister, that's enough nonsense for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil takes a hypo from the nurse and approaches Kristen s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen, I'm Doctor Goldman.  I'm not going to hurt you.  I'm just going to give you something to help you sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRISTEN goes berserk again and kicks Neil in the stomach. thrown off balance and crashes into a rolling cart -- med instruments shower to the floor. Kristen grabs a pair of wicked-looking surgical scissors. slashes at max's hand, drawing blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, Max!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen huddles into a corner, ready to skewer anybody wh close.  A tense stand-off. Kristen, put the scissors down!  No- body's gonna hurt you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the girl makes no move to drop her guard.  She starts back and forth, coming apart at the seams, moaning a litt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five, six, grab your crucifix... seven, eight, better stay up late... nine, ten, never...never...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't seem to find the words in her confused mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never sleep again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instant silence in the room.  All eyes go to NANCY THOMPS standing in the doorway.  She's a young woman now, posses beauty and great inner strength.  her hair still bears th streak.  She speaks as if coming out of a trance:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who taught you that rhyme?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Her eyes are locked with Nancy's.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: The staff members part before her as she walks to Kristen takes the scissors from Kristen's hand.  Kristen falls in Nancy's arms, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: stares at Nancy in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Nancy are finishing a late lunch in teh nearly d cafeteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get to meet them all tomorrow. They're...survivors.  In a way.  All severely sleep disordered.  Insomnia, narcolepsy, bedwetting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nightmares are the common thread?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  They seem to share a group delusion,  a "boogeyman" for lack of a better word.  They're so traumatized, they'll do anything not to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playing with his coffee) We lost a kid about a month ago to Fairview.  I don't know where he got the razor...but he cut off his own eyelids to stay awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever work with vets? (Nancy shakes her head) These kids act like they've got D.S.S. -- Delayed Stress Syndrome. If I didn't know better, I'd swear  they'd seen heavy combat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be so sure they haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs, not answering.  Neil lets it pass. (changing the subject) By the way, that was great work with the new patient.  Pretty smooth for an intern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had some experience with pattern nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've been told.  Practically an  obsession of your.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it a passion. (glances at her watch) I've got to get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure to check in with Max, he'll give you the 25 cent tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gathers her things.  Her purse falls over, scattering contents.  A bottle of pills rolls out.  Neil helps gathe items -- he picks up the pills.

dialogues.speaker: PILL BOTTLE
dialogues.text: The label reads: HYPNOCYL 60 mg.  1-2 TABS FOR SLEEP.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: She takes the pills and stuffs them in her purse along wi everything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  See you in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is almost out the door when Neil calls to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you call me Neil.  What was that nursery rhyme all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just something children sing...to keep the boogeyman away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits.  Neil stares after her thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: LONG LENS OF THE CROWDED HALLWAY
dialogues.text: As Nancy turns and vanishes from sight, a NUN is a white revealed at the far end of the hallway -- she seems to be at him.  PEOPLE are wiping frame as they criss-cross the affording mere glimpses of her.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: A bit slf-conscious.  Is the woman really staring at him?

dialogues.speaker: LONG LENS
dialogues.text: People keep wiping frame as they bustle in the hallway. is now gone.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: frowns, puzzled.  he dismisses it and downs his last sip coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is giving Nancy a tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole wing's devoted ot this  program.  That's your office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little basic, but nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a file cabinet in there before tomorrow. (leading her down a hall) The patient's rooms are down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy pauses at an open door, looking into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIP, 16, sits at a work table fashioning the face of homemade marionette out of clay.  Other marionettes hang wall. A comical dog, a white knight, a clown, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from doorway) This is Phillip.  We call him The Walker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I sleepwalk.  A perfectly normal event that our illustrious staff loves to theorize about endlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip, this is Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Welcome to the Snake Pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (admiring marionettes) Nice work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They really oughtta be carved out of  wood, but they won't let me have a knife.  I might, you know... (mimes slashing his wrist) Fffft!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lump over there is Kincaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid is lying on a bed, reading a comic book. Take a close look.  He gets his ass thrown in the Quiet Room so often,  you probably won't see much of him. Right, Cool Breeze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do it so I don't have to look at your face all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) Riiiigghht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Nancy move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLYING WITH Max and Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're good kids.  But don't let 'em fool you.  They're dangerous...to  themselves and each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit frame.  PAN TO JOEY, a wan 16 year old watching from around the corner.  He has a tear drop drawn in ink eye. A SOFT RYTHMIC SQUEAKING draws his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCIE, a cute 19 year old candy-striper, is wheeling a c laundry closet. As she begins to load the cart with clean towels, several the floor.  Joey hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey picks up the towels and holds them out to Marcie.  S him a bright smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why thank you, Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey grins mutely, obviously smitten.  LORENZO, a cocky, young orderly appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Marcie.  These going to C Ward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, I'll walk you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start down the hall, the cart still SQUEAKING RYTHMI Marcie turns back, giving Joey a smile and a wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: smiles weakly as he watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy guides Kristen's mother through signing a sheaf of forms.  Elaine is carefully and expensively dressed in fa tennis clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Parker, was Kristen acting different? Did you notice anything strange before  she made the attempt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen specializes in strangeness.  I've spent thousands on psychiatirists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she always have nightmares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've gotten worse since I took away her credit cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Miss Thompson, I don't know what you want from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some answers.  There are other kids involved, its not just Kristen.  All  good kids, smark kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that, but you're the experts on this, not me.  If I had any insights, believe me, I'd share them with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) Now if you'll excuse me, I have to get to the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need to take her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maid packed a suitcase. (calling out) Teresa!  Teresa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it.  Please, I don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First door up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy enters and finds the suitcase on the bed.  As she t leave, her eye is caught by:

dialogues.speaker: THE PAPER MACHE ELM STREET HOUSE
dialogues.text: sitting on Kristen's drafting table.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Amazed.  Shaken.  She reaches out slowly, almost afraid t it.  She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil sits at a computer terminal in his study.  He hooks to his phone and accesses a mainframe.  The screen comes blinking.  He punches in a command.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: A readout appears, ticking down an endless list of drug  categories.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Working the keyboard, searching for something.  Finally:

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: The glowing green letters read: HYPNOCYL FDA classification:  Experimental. Effective for management of psychotic disorders.  For sedation where dreamless sleep is considered optimal; suppression of night terror.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: He shuts down the computer and eases back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy sits in a thin, high-tech reading chair, engrossed Kristen's medical file.  The paper mache Elm Street House a table nearby.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Shee is starting to nod off as she reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen lies in bed, sketching on a newsprint pad with ch A rendering of the Elm Street House. She begins to nod out.  her eyes flutter closed.  CAMERA IN TIGHT on her face.  We hear the DISTANT, GHOSTLY JINGL tricycle bell.  Her eyes slowly open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen watches, terrified, as a tricycle rolls into the itself, leaving bloody tire tracks.  The same tricycle th belonged to the Little Girl.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRICYCLE
dialogues.text: comes to a stop...then begins to glow red-hot and melt, w and sagging as if from an astonishing inner heat.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: gets out of bed, edges past the ghastly melting apparitio backs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: As she backs out the door, we see it is the red Elm Stree She pauses, realizing something is terribly wrong -- sudd door SLAMS SHUT INTO CAMERA. CAMERA ZOOMS OUT IN A DIZZYING RUSH to reveal the Elm Str House.  Kristen is now trapped inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen tries to get out, but the door is locked.  She tu looking for another means of escape.  We hear a FAINT BUZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen enters.  The BUZZING IS LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: THE DINNER TABLE
dialogues.text: The table is set for a formal dinner.  The grotesque, rot remains of a roast pig sits on a platter, covered with fl

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: is revolted.

dialogues.speaker: THE PIG
dialogues.text: leaps up, SQUEALING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen is suddenly pulled down, vanishing beneath the su the liquid floor.  The furnishings remain, hanging in the gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen thrashes wildly in the the pitch-black water.  Sh frantically, lungs bursting for air.  Impossible to tell is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door hanging in watery limbo a short distance ahead.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: swims for it.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: She clutches the ornate handle and strains to open the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open.  Kristen emerges from a solid wall and steps into the room.  She is magically dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the Elm Street living room, foreboding and nearly b furniture. A large lump forms under the rug at the far end of the ro undulates toward her sinuously.  A long tubular shape. Kristen backs away. The shape circles her aimlessly, then slithers up the wal huge, writhing entity traveling within the wall surface. The shape arcs back down toward the carpet and disappears the floorline. Kristen turns about apprehensively, searching for the mys entity.  Beat. Suddenly, the creatures erupts through the floor directly her in a shower of wood splinters, engulfing her legs as rockets straight up.  It slams back down like a whale sur Kristen locked firmly in its jaws.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: is a gigantic serpent/worm version of Freddy, ribbed and encrusted with mucous and slime.  Its slavering jaws disl like a snake's, the skin stretching grotesquely as it beg swallow Kristen from the legs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) NANCY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E.C.U. Nancy dozing.  Her eyes flutter open as she hears REVERBERATION of Kristen's call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy strains to listen -- all is silent now.  uneasy, sh from her chair...but freezes in place as she hears the UN CALL again, brely discernable.  She turns.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELM STREET HOUSE MODEL
dialogues.text: The sound seems to emanate from the strange paper mache d CAMERA RUSHES IN TIGHT as its tiny front door swings slow

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: DOLLYING IN TIGHT ON HER FACE as she puts a hand to her h feeling of dizziness suddenly washing over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sinks back into her chair -- and keeps right on going impossibly sucked away into the thin chair.  She is gone blink of an eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large ornate oval mirror hangs on the wall.  The glass as Nancy bursts into the room. She rises, staring in horror and disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horrid Freddy/snake expands and contracts around Kris slowly wolfing her down, its awful diseased maw inching u her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCY!

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: snaps into action.  She scoops up a long jagged shard of mirror, cutting her palm in the process. She leaps into the fray, jamming the shard of glass into  Freddy/snake's eye -- the eye bursts, spraying rancid ich

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY/SNAKE
dialogues.text: Regurgitating Kristen, the creature arcs back, ready to s his good eye locks on Nancy, recognizing his old enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (total rage) YOU!

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY/SNAKE
dialogues.text: ROARS as the snake face peels back like old parchment and instantly transforms into a mind blowing skull/snake/Fred horns and double rows of razor teeth -- striking INTO CAM

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: grabs Kristen and barrel-rolls out of the way.  They scra the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy slams the door and fumbles with the lock, snapping place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pulled me in somehow, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I think so!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The razor-teeth burst through the door, splintering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get us back out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen tries to concentrate -- the teeth tear a chunk fr door and the Freddy/beast's drooling snout lunges through Chewing.  Tearing. NOW, KRISTEN!  DO IT NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering, pleading) Wake up , wake up, wake up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door EXPLODES in on them as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nancy thrashes awake in her reading chair, knocking a cup coffee across them room.  She is shaking in the aftermath terror, her fists clenched tight, not knowing if she just it all or not. Suddenly realizing, she unclenches her hand -- the palm i from the shard of broken mirror she plunged into Freddy/s eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy bursts in with the Elm Street House model under her hurries down the hallway -- right past Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't get much sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we've got --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's already turned the corner and gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy rushes up to Kristen's room and looks in.  Empty. appears, coming up the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, where's Kristen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been waiting outside your office since breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy rushes around the corner and stops.  Kristen is sit patiently in the hallway outside Nancy's office.  She sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up Elm Street model) I used to live in this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...it's just a house I've dreamed  about. (lower) I dream about it all the time. (pause) Thank you for what you did last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Kristen speak in low tones with the door closed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever done that before?  Pulled someone into your dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreamy, far-away look) When I was a little girl.  Three or four. If I had a nightmare, I'd bring my Dad in. The dream would always get better. (smiles) He always used to tell me about it the  next day -- he used to think they were his dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did it stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was still a kid.  My folks got divorced. (beat) After a while, I thought I'd imagined the whole thing.  I guess I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an amazing gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  Then, softly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man in my dreams.  He's real isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the kids of the Adolescent Care Unit are gathered:  K Phillip, Taryn, Joey, Jennifer, and WILL, a 17 year old c to an electric wheelchair.  Kristen's a bit uncomfortable the new kid.  The general impression is of a blitzed-out just out of heavy combat.  Nancy takes of a blitzed-out s out of heavy combat.  Nancy takes her place next to Eliza Simms as Neil closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Group's in session.  Straight  talk only in this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today I'd like to start by getting us acquainted with our new staff member, Nancy Thompson.  Let's make her feel  welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids murmur a chorus of AD-LIBBED GREETINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see, you've already met Phillip,  Kincaid, and Kristen.  Why don't the  rest of you tell Nancy something about yourselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: neil absently toys with the row of hanging metal balls on those click-clack kinetic toys sitting on the table.  No  volunteers. Will?  How about you first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Will Stanton, and um...I've had a little accident, as you can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accident my ass.  I thought this was supposed to be straight talk in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, so he took a jump.  At least he wasn't sticking needles in his arms with a bunch of lowlifes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it, Kincaid.  Jennifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jennifer Caulfield.  When I get out of here I'm going to L.A. to be  an actress.  i'm gonna be on T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Lifestyles of the Rich and Psychotic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you. (indicates Joey) This is Joey.  He used to be a debater in school, but now he doesn't talk much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey grins at Nancy shyly, nodding his head in greeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Taryn White.  I only came here because it was a better deal than  juvie hall. (pause) Also, I guess 'cause I'm going through some very stange shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Hey, everybody has bad dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I interject something here?  Just to save us all some time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nancy) According to our kind hosts, our dreams are a group psychosis.  Sort of a mellow mass hysteria.  The fact that we all  dreamt about this guy before we ever met doesn't seem to impress anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids murmur in agreement. So we go in circles making minimal progress with maximum effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you won't make any progress until you can recognize your dreams for what they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The by-product of guilt.  Psychological scars steaming from moral conflicts and overt sexuality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  Now it's my dick that's killing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them, Nancy.  Tell them what's  really going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Yes, tell us, Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can say is this isn't something that's just going to disappear.  you're all going to have to face it.  Fight it. And if you're willing to work together... wiling to stand up to your deepest fears...I think we can beat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their expressions reflect a quiet mix of hope and fear. impressed -- all except Kincaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My deepest fear is listening to any more of this rah-rah bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits in his wheelchair with his Dungeons and Dragons spread out on the table before him.  Taryn's not really i but she's playing along.  Joey sits nearby, following the with rapt attention.  Taryn throws the dice. Will refers to his Dungeonmaster's card.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARD
dialogues.text: features an illustration of a wizard in flowing robes.  M lightning crackles from his fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're attacked by the Bog Demon. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls dice) Uh, fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't count.  You gotta say the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) In the name of Elric, Prince of Elves, demon begone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  You conquer the demon, but your horse is sinking in the bog.  What do  you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yawns) I go to bed and get a new horse in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits.  Will turns to Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I score that?  Enchanted slumber or Death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey makes a throat-cutting motion.  Max enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen.  It's lights out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Max...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max lifts Will gently out of his wheelchair and lays him bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Joey. (Joey scrambles into bed) 'Night, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max turns out the lights and exits, closing the door.  Be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the first shift tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey throws back the covers and sits up.  He shakes his h points, indicating that it's Will's turn. Come on, I had it last night. (Joey shrugs, giving in) Okay, just keep your eyes open.  One  whimper and you wake me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Nancy having a quiet dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been here before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have opened while I was away at  school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most authentic Mexican food in Springwood, which isn't saying much. (beat) your parents still live around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's dead.  Died in her sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father an I...well, the family just seemed to fall apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a rough time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was. (beat) Neil, do you believe in other realities?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been to Pittsburgh.  Does that count?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...I believe in different levels of conciousness, that sort of thing...but if you're into UFO's or Atlantis, you've lost me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I told you your patients are in real physical danger from their dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a new one.  Is that what they're teaching now at Stanford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nightmares are nothing but a symptom of their real problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Then let's eliminate the  symptom for the time being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Hypnocyl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to prescribe an experimental psychoactive drug to a bunch of suicidal teenagers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just until we get things under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Dream deprivation is nothing to fool  around with.  you have no business  taking it yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be like them, Neil.  I know what they're going through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? (beat) You told me they're survivors...and they are.  But how much longer they survive is up to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Nancy.  The answer is no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip and Kincaid lie sleeping in their beds.  DOLLY SL on Phillip.  He moans softly -- perhaps a troubled dream. BOOM UP TO the marionettes hanging on the wall.  An eerie collection of moonlit figures. DOLLY IN FOR CLOSEUP on the unfinished marionette.  It ra gray, misshapen head. The crude clay features ripple and change into a distinct of Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: MARIONETTE'S HAND
dialogues.text: Sharp razor-claws generate from the stubby clay fingers.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY/MARIONETTE
dialogues.text: swipes his claws at his strings, cutting himself loose.

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Freddy/marionette lands in a cat-like crouch.  As he stra up, he starts to grow.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: stirs...his eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy/marionette rises into view at teh foot of the bed. into the full-sized Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: opens his mouth to scream.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: holds a finger to his lips, signaling for silence.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: gasps for breath, suddenly paralyzed.  His blanket is mag snapped off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: flicking downward with a single blade, quickly, precisely and again.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: in excruciating pain, unable to move a muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down at Phillip.  Clean, nearly bloodless incisio been made down the length of each arm and leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one long strand of sinewy muscle tissue leaps up  out of incision.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: His muscle/strings go taut -- he's lifted from his bed.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: Stirs awake and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip is walking out of the room, apparently sleepwalki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Hey Phillip.  Wake up, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING PHILLIP
dialogues.text: His terrified eyes are bulging as he leaves the room, bei manipulated at the end of his strings like a marionette. In the background, Kincaid rolls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grumbling) Have a nice stroll, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip is "puppeted" slowly down the hallway.  Tears rol his checks as he rolls his eyes wildly, looking for a way this nightmare.  No use.  He has no control over his move

dialogues.speaker: NURSE'S STATION
dialogues.text: A NIGHT NURSE is dioing paperwork at her station.  Nearby JANITOR mops the floor. Neither of them notice Phillip as he sleepwalks past in t background.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP/MARIONETTE
dialogues.text: The moment he is out of thei view, he walks into a wall.. dissolves right through it.  So much for hospital securit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is sitting by the windwo in the dark, wide awake.  P time.  A movement catches his eye, he glances out the win

dialogues.speaker: THE BELL TOWER
dialogues.text: It stands stories above the rest of the massive, rambling hospital, the apex of all teh wings of the building.  TIL the archway at the top of the belltower.  The small, pale of Phillip stands on teh ledge.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: staring in horror, his mouth opening and closing as he tr call for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weeping with terror, Phillip teeters at teh lip of the le an awesome, dizzying drop -- the courtyard is far below. The strings jerk Phillip forward and back, toying with hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frantic, Joey turns from the windwo and drags Will out of Will is groggy, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?  What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey drags Will across teh floor to the window, pointing.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY AND WILL
dialogues.text: Will sees Phillip on the bell tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold dread) Oh shit.  Get help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey races from the room as Will starts pounding the wind PHILLIP!  PHILLIP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey runs to the Nurse at her station, gesturing in panic hops around frantically, motioning for her to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't understand) Joey, what's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freaks out and grabs a metal tray off the counter.  Th dinner goes flying.  Joey runs down the hall, slamming th against the walls. The kids appear from their rooms in a state of confusion. members come running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is still pounding the window, hollering.  Joey runs others pour in after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIP!  WAKE UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip teeters on the edge.  He looks up, eyes pleading with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant transparent Freddy, seen from the waist up, looms night sky, higher than thebell tower.  he is leaning over building from behind as if it were a marionette stage, la maniacally as he puppets Phillip. Freddy draws back his claw hand -- then slashes out, slic Phillip's strings.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: The puppet spell is broken -- he SCREAMS, arms windmillin frantically as he falls from teh ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip plummets from the tower.

dialogues.speaker: THE KIDS AT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: There is a horrible THUMP as Phillip impacts.  Some kids SCREAMING, some are crying, all horrified beyond words. members are helpless as bedlam reigns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Group is in session.  The kids seem sullen, fragile,  disconnected...without hope.  Neil looks beaten-down, les assured than usual -- Phillip's death has shaken him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk about what happened last night.  Let's get all our feelings out in the open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids hold silent for a long moment, then Kincaid offe grudging appraisal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't strong enough.  So he got  wasted, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all?  Is that what you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't hack it and he got nailed. Period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contmpt) Oh yeah, big tough badass.  How long  you gonna last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longer than any of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Go ahead and fight.  That's what he  wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who. (to Kristen) What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To turn us against each other...so we'll be weak.  Easy prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horseshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes go to Nancy.  Simms shoots her a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're all missing the point  here.  Phillip's death was a sleepwalking accident.  Nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I could see him up there.  His face. He was wide awake...all the way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it was suicide.  Phillip quit.  He copped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey shakes his head, getting agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey says it wasn't no suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil lets some of his anger and frustration show through:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, listen to me!  Phillip killed  himself.  And that's a cowardly thing. An empty thing.  he let himself down. he let all of us down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is blinking back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was murder!  Can't you understand that?  That bastard murdered him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spooked) You never know when he's going to come. Sometimes for days, nothing...then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard quite enough of this.  How long before you're ready to face your- selves?  How much longer can you keep blaming your dreams for your own  weaknesses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much longer you gonna blow smoke up our ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, Kincaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be no repeat occurences of last night's events.  From now on, your doors will be locked during sleeping  hours.  We'll begin a policy of evening sedation.  For everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A terrified reaction from the group.  Nancy shoots Neil a look, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) The fuck you will.  Anybody tries to drug me gets his ass kicked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising, angry) You just bought yourself a night in the Quiet Room, mister.  Now sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Fuck you!  You sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms presses a button, summoning help.  Neil rises, prep protect Simms if necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Kincaid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and another ORDERLY enter.  Kincaid starts to freak. a chair at them, screaming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOBODY'S GONNA PUT ME TO SLEEP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The orderlies get Kincaid into an armlock and wrestle him fighting and kicking, out the door. Simms follows the struggle out into the hallway.  Neil an join her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms, flushed and livid, watches Kincaid get dragged awa turns to Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll begin sedation tonight.  Starting with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't!  They'll be defenseless against their dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's precisely what they need.  Some uninterrupted REM sleep to release all this negative energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Neil, desperate) Neil, please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil pauses, wavering between nancy and Simms.  He finall to a decision:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, I'm prescribing Hypnocyl. (she gives him a  blank stare) It's a dream suppressant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it is.  I just can't believe what I'm hearing. (indicates Nancy) What has she talked you into?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  They're my patients.  It's  my decision.  I want the dreams stopped until we get some answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't allow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go straight to Carver if I have to.  He'll either back me up or accept my resignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms pauses, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If soemthing goes wrong, I'll make sure you're held responsible.  Fully responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms exits.  Neil watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I just did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think we can get the Hypnocyl in by tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and walks away -- but pauses, looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you know what you're getting us into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLYING with Max as he works his way down the hall, spot the dorm area.  Nancy appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puttin' in soem late hours, I see.  If you're trying for O.T., you're in the  wrong place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to be here for the kids. how are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restless.  Very restless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen appears at her door, looking sleepy and exhausted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy?  Would you sit with me awhile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nancy) You need me, I'll be here all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to join Kristen in her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taryn, wearing robe and slippers, emerges from the women' bathroom and shuffles back toward her room. Lorenzo, the young orderly, appears in her path, twirling keyring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, sweet stuff.  Good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disinterested, tries to get past him) Can't be good news coming from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulled night duty.  Trimble's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (twirling keys) So...got the keys to heaven, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dispensary.  I'm talking clean pharmaceutical high.  A night at Club meth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steps past him) I don't do that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her wrist, exposing her arm -- her skin is scarr old needle tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are these, beauty marks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yanks her arm away) Those are ancient history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?  Well, if you're ever in the mood for a history lesson, I'm your  teacher, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of my face or I'll go straight to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now who's gonna take the word of a crazy junkie chick like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads off to her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rather drab, institutional room with second-hand couche chairs.  jennifer sits in a worn armchair watching the TV massive old metal RCA.  She is fighting sleep, but starti off.  Max enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that. You watch too damn much TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.  You're gonna be a TV star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait and see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Simms catches you in here after lights out, she'll chew my ass ragged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading) I gotta stay up, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tonight, please?  I can't handle the nightmare.  Not tonight.  Not after Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hesitates...then relents against his better judgement

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get caught, I never saw you. Deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Deal.  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max exits, shaking his head.  Jennifer turns back to the Late Show drones on.  She shakes herself, still fighting awake. She digs a hidden pack of cigarettes from under the chair and lights up.  She takes a deep drag -- then, wincing wi burns her hand with the lit cigarette.  Anything to stay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen lies in bed.  Nancy sits nearby in a chair -- it may keep an all-night vigil. She notices an array of gymnastics posters taped to the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like gymnastics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I was on the team at school. (beat) I was never very good, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not always as good at things as we'd like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I was really not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I was really not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh softly. I'm glad you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy pauses, wrestling with a decision.  She digs into h pulls out her bottle of Hypnocyl, and shakes the contents hand.  Just two pills left.  She gives them to Kristen. What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) They'll keep the dreams away.  For tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is still fighting to stay awake as she watches T switches around with the channel changer, stopping on a D Cavett interview.  His guest is Sally Kellerman.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: nodding out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that is the great American dream, isn't it?  To come to L.A. and be a TV star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image sputters with snowy interference.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: Her eyes fluttering.

dialogues.speaker: TV SET
dialogues.text: Alternating between snow and image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- find a good teacher.  An actor has  to study, to learn.  I think that's crucial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gleefully) WHO GIVES A FUCK WHAT YOU THINK?

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: Her eyes snap open, her body stiffening.  She stares at:

dialogues.speaker: TEH TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: Nothing now but static.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: Frowning.  Must have imagined it.  She rises and smacks t of the set, trying to get the picture back.  Nothing. Suddenly, two arms rip from each side of the TV set and g by the shoulders.  The arms are a horrid hybrid of Freddy and RCA tubes and wiring.  She SCREAMS as she is lifted o ground.

dialogues.speaker: TV SET
dialogues.text: Freddy's head grows and stretches out of the top of the s wearing the rabbit-ear antenna like some horrible insect. Jennifer keeps SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it, Jennifer!  Your big break in TV!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he rams her head into the screen with hideously brutal fo there is an EXPLOSION of glass and electrical sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A midwestern cemetary on a rolling hillside.  A gentle dr falls on a crowd of mourners clustered at twin gravesites PRIEST intones the eulogy.  Among the mourners are Dr. Si Nancy...but Neil is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring as the caskets are lowered.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER
dialogues.text: CAMERA BOOMS BACK to reveal Neil standing on a rise overl the funeral.  he's under the shelter of a large oak tree, still soaked by the drizzle.  He stares down, grief-stric tears masked by rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ashamed, young man.  This is a place for sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nun in white stands clsoe by (Neil saw her in the hos hallway).  She appears in her 60's, but carries herself w strength that belies her years.  Neil wipes his eyes. What faith do you follow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chokes back a bitter laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Science...I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are times when it doesn't offer much comfort. (pause) I've seen you before.  Sister...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Helena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do volunteer work at the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come from time to time.  When I'm needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil turns his gaze back toward the funeral, lost in his private grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I could've saved them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one thing can save the children. The unquiet spirit must be laid to  rest.  It is an abomination to God and Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blankly) I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling O.S.) Neil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil turns and moves to the edge of the rise as Nancy cre hill.  The services have ended, the crowd is dispersing. What are you doing up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just talking to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, but the nun is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.  Let's get out of this rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they head slowly down the hill, PAN TO THE NUN IN CLOS she is fingering a rosary and whispering a prayer as she them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON NEIL at the window, staring out at the rain.  He quietly, almost as if to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to think I could do something about it...make some kind of difference ...but they keep slipping through my  fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises a nearly empty wineglass and drains the last si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remains of a Chinese takeout dinner is spread on the Nancy is crouched near the fireplace, feeding paper carto flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop blaming yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm running out of answers. A patient sleepwalks out of a security ward up to a tower with no access.  A girl,  alone in a room, dies by jumping six feet straight up into a television set. Nothing makes sense anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers it) Only if you're willing to put aside  everything you've learned and trust me. Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nancy closes the door and faces the remaining kids:  Kris Kincaid, Will, Taryn, and Joey.  Neil sits by with a clip his knee.  Dr. Simms is conspicuously absent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Straigh talk only in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Group?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, unofficially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty soon there won't be enough of us left to call it "Group."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up.  Nancy's got something to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I know who's trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fucking humor us.  We're not in  the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears a dirty brown hat. (this gets their attention) He's horribly burned. (all eyes on her) He has razors on his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy Krueger.  He was a child murderer before he died.  After he died, he became ...something worse. (beat) Six years ago Freddy killed my friends. He almost killed me.  I thought I got rid of him -- but I guess he was too strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thick silence.  The kids stare at her, flabbergasted, not whether to believe or doubt.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he after us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  What did we ever do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not what you did.  Your parents.  My  parents.  They burned him alive. We're paying for their sins. (softly) You're the last of the Elm Street children.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING THE KIDS
dialogues.text: as they react with bewilderment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't grasp it) Mom and Dad?  That's...crazy.  They         never said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure.  That's just the sorta thing parents tell their kids:  "Goodnight honey.  Don't forget ot say your prayers. Oh, by the way, your father and I torched some maniac last night."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do about this creep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time, it was me against him.  I wasn't strong enough...alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching the thread) But together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen's the key.  She's got a very special talent.  A gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been able to do that since I was a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it the other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never lose a gift like that.  You just forget how to use it. (beat) How about it?  Will you try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen nods. Each one of you has an inner strength -- some special power you've had in your most wonderful dreams.  Together we  can learn to use those powers...if we try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to Nancy) You sound like Peter Pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember -- open mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dimming the lights) Okay, we're going to try a little group hypnosis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to a high-tech chrome pendulum device sitting on tabletop and flicks a switch.  The pendulum rocks slowly to side as a tiny blip of high intensity light flashes  intermittently.  Everybody stares at the device. I want you all to follow the pendulum with your eyes.  Tune out everything  else...nothing else exists but the  pendulum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Take us there, Kristen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe deeply and relax...starting with your toes, relax everything until there's  no tension left in your bodies.  None at all.  Keep following the pendulum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they stare at the device, becoming mesmerized. You find yourselves getting tired.  Nothing wuld feel better right now than a nice, long, deep sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENDFRAME on Kristen.  Eyes fluttering closed. I'm going to count backwards from five, and when I finish, you will all be  asleep.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: watching the pendulum, lulled under its spell. Five...four...three...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: staring at the device, counting down. ...two...one.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Her eyes snap open, she looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks up.  The room is stil teh same, nothing ha changed.  neil switches the device off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody reacts, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody take five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several kids stand up to stretch their legs.  Neil turns drawing her aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I was willing to go along with this for the kids' peace of mind...and yours.  But you've got to face reality...

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: He is at the water cooler getting a drink.  He pauses, he RYTHMIC SQUEAKING OF A CART.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcie, the cute candy-striper, appears just outside the her cart.  She sees him and stops.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: gives her a goofy grin, totally in love.

dialogues.speaker: MARCIE
dialogues.text: looks arund to see if anybody is watching -- then smiles gestures to him.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: He glances around, then slips out the door unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcie checks again to make sure nobody is watching, then for Joey to follow her.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: hurries after her, his knees going weak.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The kids are still taking a break.  neil is absently-mind toying with the metal click-clack balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, let's try one more time.  If it doesn't work, then I promise --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: neil raises the end ball and sends it into the others -- of click-clacking, they simply float apart into mid-air. nancy gapes as the metal balls float past her head. All activity comes to a standstill.  Everybody stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where...here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  We're in the dream.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Staring at the balls, rapt and fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly...we're in Group...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my dreams, I can walk.  My legs are strong.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: They all turn to see Will standing straight and tall.  No his wheelchair. In my dreams, I'm the Dungeonmaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plucks a metal ball from teh air, holds it in his fist blows in one end -- a fantasy dragonfly appears out the o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it.  Neil, we made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ducking the dragonfly) This isn't possible. (beat) And even if it is...what the hell am I doing here? (to Kristen) Did you drag me in here too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen grins sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try soemthing, Kristen.  What can you do in your dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen take s afew steps back, then launches herself int perfectly executed series of twisting handflips across th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfct score!  The crowd goes wild!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid picks up a metal chair and twists it open like a with his bare hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A.  Dig this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid, please.  That's very unnerving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, check out Taryn.

dialogues.speaker: TARYN
dialogues.text: She's become a brethtaking street punk, like something ou rock fantasy:  shimmering platinum hair swept back in a w Mohawk, and sleep black leathers with delicate silver cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my dreams, I'm beautiful --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flicks out a wicked gravity knife and twirls it open than the eye can follow. -- and bad.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY AND NEIL
dialogues.text: Neil looking around, still trying to grasp it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it slowly.  Remember, this is a dream. Anything is possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy nods.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: He closes his eys and concentrates, trying an experiment. opens his eyes and sees:

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Now wearing a frilly negligee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids laugh and hoot.  neil blushes, very flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice dreaming, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is an unoccupied dorm room.  Marcie leads Joey in.  Sh the door softly, then turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
