dialogues.text: Listen, Joey...I just wanted to get you alone for a second.  i mean... (beat) Look, I really like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps closer.  Joey gulps. Do you like me? (Joey nods) This may sound crazy, but...I make up excuses to come into the ward every day just to see you.  you're so cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's eyes widen.  She sits him on the bed and stands in him. I could get into a lot of trouble for this, but I know you won't say anything. Will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey shakes his head violently.  She turns her back to hi Unzip me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey reaches up and unzips her with shaking hands. She turns back and shrugs off ehr uniform.  She is wearin skimpy panties.  She is magnificent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coy smile) Do you like my body, Joey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is overwhelmed. Marcie pushes Joey gently back on the bed and crawls on t with sinewy grace.  SHe starts unbuttoning his shirt and his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcie kisses his mouth, her tongue probing deeply. Too deeply.  Joey gags and draws back -- but Marcie's ton supernaturally long and burrows deeper into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: Choking.  he grabs the writhing tongue and tries to pull his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MARCI
dialogues.text: The tail end of her tongue leaps out of her mouth with a its own.

dialogues.speaker: ON JOEY
dialogues.text: Both ens of the tongue/creature whip around his wrist and back, twining around the bedpost like a bullwhip.

dialogues.speaker: MARCIE
dialogues.text: A second hideously long tongue shoots out of her mouth, t the air --

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: -- and lashes his other arm to the other bedpost with a T Freddy's maniacal LAUGHTER rings out.  joey looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcie's head has been replaced by Freddy's -- his grotes laughing face perched atop her lovely body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gleefully) What's wrong, Joey?  I thought you liked my body!

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: Two more tongues fly from his mouth simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY'S FEET
dialogues.text: are lashed to the footboard bedposts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking directly down on Joey writhing on the bed.  The m drops away beneath him, descending a shaft exactly it's s mattress is engulfed in a fiery inferno below.  CRANE UP is left suspended over a hellish pit of flame, trying des to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights suddenly dim and flicker out.  Everybody comes standstill, looking around apprehensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's heavy in the halls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing) Where's Joey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They glance around -- Joey's not with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy's got him!  We've got to help him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil grabs the door to throw it open -- but yanks his han the knob glows red hot.  The door begins to scorch and si the room turns stifling hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room's changing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls begin to close in -- the group is backed into t of the room as it becomes rounded, cylindrical...like the of a furnace.  Rivets appear as the walls become scorched plate.  Neil staggers back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy...crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- his feet are slogging through smouldering ash.  He ste child's charred ribcage -- it crumbles and snaps underfoo brittle leaf.  A tiny skull is churned up.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: hunkers down and tries to push through the steel door, bu back as his hands are burned.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: looks about helplessly as the smoke gets denser.  ROARING leap up around them.  Suddnely --

dialogues.speaker: THE FURNACE DOOR
dialogues.text: slams open to reveal Simms standing in a perfectly normal hallway.  Total silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Group Therapy Room.  Neil, Nancy, and the others are their chairs, heads coming up as the awaken.  They gaze a still confused. What's wrong with Joey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey is lying unconscious on the floor near his chair, ar legs spread-eagle (in the same pose as being lashed to th Simms rushes over and checks him. He's not breathing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil pushes her out of the way and kneels over Joey, desp giving him mouth-to-mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON JOEY lying in a coma, hooked up to monitoring de a respirator.  ANGLE WIDENS SLOWLY as we DOLLY BACK, reve team of TECHNICIANS and NUEROSURGEONS surrounding the bed CONTINUE DOLLYING BACK until we find ourselves IN THE HAL outside the room.  neil and Nancy hover by the door, sick worry.  DOCTOR CARVER (60's), the supervising physician o Hills, is stewing in controlled anger.  Dr. Simms is self righteous now that her predicted disaster has taken place The nuerosurgeons exit the room.

dialogues.speaker: NUEROSURGEON
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) He's in a deep coma.  There's nothing we can do for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurosurgeons walk away.  Carver turn to Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insexcusable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The session was unauthorized.  It was purposely conducted without my knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unusual steps were called for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what I should tell this young  man's parents? (beat) I understand you prescribed a highly  experimental drug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Carver, he's not in a coma because of the Hypnocyl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young lady, your opinion is of no  interest to me.  Furthermore,  according to Dr. Simms, you've been creating panic among the patients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Goldman, in the last four days we've had two suicides.  Now a boy is in a  coma.  I think it's fair to say your approach has failed...entirely. (beat) You're both relieved of your duties. I want you out of here.  Today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Carver --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil motions her quiet.  Carver exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Neil.  You brought this on yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) For God's sake, Elizabeth...just try to help the kids, will you?  Listen to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits.  Only Nancy and Neil remain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) There's nothing we can do.  It's out of our hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away.  She watches his go, then look in Joey.  S desolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil has packed several boxes of personal files into the his BMW.  He places the final box in -- it's stuffed with from the kids...and some photographs.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTOGRAPH ON TOP
dialogues.text: A picture of a group picnic -- featuring Neil with Jennif Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: stares sadly at the picture for an extended beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Neil slams the trunk, the unused wing of the hospital revealed in the background.  It is old, untended, crumbli shrouded white figure is standing in one of the upper flo windows.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: sees the figure and reacts, startled.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE IN THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: is the nun from the funeral.  She has been staring out th at him.  She turns away and disappears from view.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: pauses for a moment, then approaches the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil comes to a set of double doors and rattles them -- t sealed with a rusty chain and padlock. He moves to a broken window and peers through the boards across it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can see into the long main hallway of the ground floor gets a brief glimpse of the nun at the far end as she com the stairs, turns on the landing, and heads downstairs to basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knocking on the board) Sister?  Sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hasn't heard him.  He pries the loose board away and through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forgotten, dusty corridor with peeled paint like parchm the water-stained walls.  Neil comes down the stairs, pee around in the gloom. The only feature in the dead end hallway is a partially o iron door with a small barred window.  A FAINT BUZZING ri falls from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  Sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.  Just another swell of FAINT BUZZING.  Neil ap the door and pushes it open all the way.  It SQUEALS LOUD hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil enters a huge, shadowy, dungeon-like room.  Flaking pillars stand draped with cobwebs.  Rusted remains of bed and scraps of wood litter the floor.  The BUZZING grows l then falls away again. Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wooden match ignites near him, going off like a gunshot stillness -- the nun is reavealed.  Neil gasps, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where it began.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and lights a candle in a tiny alcove before a s the Virgin Mary.  Dim light sputters up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wing's been closed for years. (looking around) What was this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Purgatory...fashioned by the hands of men.  Twisted, lost souls, the worst of the criminally insane, were locked away in here like animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole facility was shut down in the Forties, wasn't it?  Some kind of  scandal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she nods) A young girl on the staff was accidentally locked in here over the holidays.  The  inmates managed to keep her hidden for days.  She was raped...hundreds of times. When they found her, she was barely  alive...and with child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girl was Amanda Krueger.  Her  child --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bastard son of a hundred maniacs. Some say he was murdered, though no  body was ever found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil is momentarily distracted by another swell of BUZZIN brushes past his face in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said something before...about  laying him to rest...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must find the remains...and bury them in hallowed ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nun turns and climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blankly) Hallowed ground?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he moves to follow her, but his foot comes in contact wit something near the bottom of the steps.  The BUZZING SWEL LOUDLY.  He jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grisly carcass of a cat stares up at Neil, hundreds o swarming in its dessicated flesh.

dialogues.speaker: THE NUN
dialogues.text: Pausing at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your only faith is science, Doctor... it may be you that's laid to rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she exits, the door begins to CREAK slowly shut behind plunging the room into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: scrambles up the steps and grabs the door just before it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil heaves a sigh of relief as he exits the Pit.  He loo around.  The nun has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy sits at Joey's bedside, gazing at the boy -- so sti frail.  She speaks in a whisper, but her voice is fierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go, you bastard.

dialogues.speaker: ON JOEY
dialogues.text: Short slashes suddenly begin to criss-cross his smooth ch

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: reacts in horror.  Neil enters B.G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes to her side and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: The slashes spell out a message in crude, bloody letters:

dialogues.speaker: NANCY AND NEIL
dialogues.text: gazing on in horror.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The car glides down a meandering road, leaving Westin Hil behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil driving, Nancy beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going in.  That's exactly what he wants.  As long as you're on Hypnocyl, it's the only way he can get to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I know that?  I don't  have any choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.  Getting yourself killed won't do the kids any good.  Besides, we do have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assuming your mysterious nun in right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard crazier things this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Whoever she is, I'll admit she seems to know more about Krueger than I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is, what happened to Freddy's body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burned him to death in his boiler room, but they were smart enough to  hide the remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would know where they were hidden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) There's only one man...and its time for him to talk.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Kristen's face as she lets out a WAIL of total a and despair -- she struggles with Max and Lorenzo as they restrain her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms is standing by, watching the struggle. You can't send them away!  You can't! They're all we have!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They weren't helping you, Kristen. You're a sick girl.  You can only get better if you trust me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen is fighting like a wildcat -- momentum carries he orderlies into the nurse's desk and sends them sprawling shower of desktop items. She hurls a heavy stapler in Simms' direction before Max Lorenzo grab her again -- they manage to pin her arms, bu

dialogues.speaker: THE KIDS
dialogues.text: are peering fearfully up the hall at the spectacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her to the Quiet Room and sedate her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen is dragged down the hall, fighting and kicking ev of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screeming) YOU STUPID BITCH!  YOU'RE KILLING US! KILLING US!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tavern" is too nice a word -- it is a dive bar with a fl neon sign on the worst side of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sort of place you wind up when you have no place left A dark, grubby figure sits in the deep foreground nursing and staring at nothing.  His unshaven face is hard and bi haunted by old sorrows.  He wears a sodden, rumpled  nightwatchman's uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONALD THOMPSON looks up slowly from his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy stands nearby with Neil.  Thompson smiles wanly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it isn't my little girl... come to visit her Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but here you are.  How'd I get so lucky?  I thought you were trying to  forget I was alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.  You're the one who's  trying to forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits across from him.  Neil hovers at her side. I need your help.  Krueger's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Fred Krueger's dead.  You always had a  little trouble understanding that, Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what he did.  He's doing it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson's eye flick up at Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, dangerous) I don't recall as we ever met, friend. And I don't believe this is any of  your goddamn business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil is taken aback for a moment -- he's about to retort, Nancy silences him with a look.  She leans in to her fath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can stop him this time.   Stop him for good.  But we need to  know where the bones were hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slow, measured) I lost too much over this already.  I'm through with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are still dying.  After all this time.  Stop running away from it. (no response) Daddy, please...don't make me beg. (still no response) You owe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson meets his daughter's gaze, then averts his eyes. takes a slow draw on his drink. It's been nice seeing you, baby. Don't stay away so long next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy can't handle another moment -- she bolt from the ta tears come.  Neil glares at Thompson and hurries after he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil folllows her to the restroom alcove, where she is tr pull herself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be okay.  Just give me a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to comfort her, but doesn't really have the word stands by, looking miserable.  His BEEPER GOES OFF.  He c for the number and crosses to the payphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taryn snatches the payphone off the wall on the first rin and Kincaid are with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Goldman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil on the phone, Nancy at his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taryn?  Is that you?  What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta come right away.  It's Kristen. She had a total shit attack when Simms

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: told us you and Nancy got fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil listens, his face draining of color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Christ. (to Nancy) Simms put Kristen in the Quiet Room for the night.  They sedated her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's too doped up to stay awake for long.  She's alone in there -- alone! Freddy's gonna get her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, none of you panic.  Just stay cool.  Help's on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get over there now.  We have to make Sims understand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He digs out his car keys and holds them out to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him, not understanding. I'm gonna get the remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating her father) Neil, it's no use.  You saw how he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go.  Kristen needs you.  Keep her awake somehow. (Nancy tries to argue) Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy takes the keys.  Their eyes lock for a long, intens -- then they share a spontaneous, passionate kiss. Nancy turns and leaves without another word.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: He sees his daughter leave, then turns his blank gaze bac beer. Neil casually walks over.  Thompson ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Neil Goldman.  Pleased to meet you. (beat) There, we've met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, unexpectedly, Neil lashes viciously out with hi and kicks the table over -- everything goes flying.  Befo Thompson can so much as blink, neil hauls him out of his slams him violently against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Thompson, nose to nose.  Neil speaks with barely contained rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, tight) Listen up, asshole.  I don't know if you care whether Nancy lives or dies, but I do. (pause) You and I are going on a little  scavenger hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson stares at Neil, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen wanders in aimless circles in the confinement of padded room, weeping with despair as she desperately trie on her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Please God...please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stumbles and lurches into the wall, held up by sheer alone.  She pushes herself away, staggering -- her moveme jerky and uncordinated. ...don't make...me...sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nancy at the wheel, steely with determination as she spee to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small church in a poor neighborhood.  Thompson's batter Dodge grinds to a stop at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dourly regards teh church) What the hell are we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil reaches over, shuts off the ignition, and takes the There is a pint bottle of whiskey juting from Thompson's pocket.  Neil snatches the bottle before Thompson can rea Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil gets out of the car.  he empties the contents of the bottle on the pavement as he hurries toward the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three WORSHIPPERS are seated in the pews, seeking comfort silent prayer.  Neil rushes in at the back of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sees a small basin of holy water attached to the wall.  h submerges Thompson's bottle, filling it with holy water. the bottle, pockets it, then proceeds up the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil comes to a candle shrine.  A foot-high crucifix is a to the wall above it.  He grabs the cross and tries to li its mount -- it comes loose with a loud CLANG, a lift it mount -- it comes loose with a loud CLANG, a jarring soun silent church.  Worshippers turn to look. Feeling comspicuous, Neil turns to find himself facing a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry, but I need this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He digs out his wallet.  Empty. I swear I'll reimburse you.  Really.  Here, keep my driver's license.  I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil hurries out, leaving the baffled priest holding his license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy enters, hurrying toward the Quiet Room.  Max appear blocking her from the Quiet Room hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, I have ot see Kristen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max shakes his head. You don't understand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big man holds up his hand for silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save your breath, Ms. Thompson.  Dr. Simms gave me specific instructions. Nobody gets to see Kristen -- especially you.  She made that real clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Max, she needs me.  It could mean life or death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pauses briefly...and decides to speak his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Look, I think you really mean well... but my kids been dyin' off.  Even if I didn't have orders from Simms, I wouldn't let you near her.  No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy backs down.  There's no way she'll get past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Max...I understand. (a plea) Can I say goodbye to the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max wavers, his emotions getting to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be my last chance.  Pleese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's against his better judgement, but Max finally nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads toward the dorms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes around the corner.  Taryn, Will, and Kincaid ha waiting for her, frantic with worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do, take the scenic route?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sshhh.  No time for that.  Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our last Group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast auto junkyard on the outskirts of town.  Towering gutted cars glitter in the moonlight like the crusty bone long ago dinosaur graveyard.  It is an awesome, twisting Thompson's Dodge pulls up to the gate.  The headlights re faded sign on the tall chain link fence:  "PENNY BROS. AU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In there.  Charlie Penny owns the place. We knew no one would ever find it.  I'm not even sure I can find it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They used to keep a spare key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson steps out and crosses to teh wood stat structure serves as the junkyard's office and reaches under the por

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson steps into the headlight beams and unlocks teh r padlock. Suddenly, a vicious junkyard dog shoots up into frame, ba slavering just inches from his face, rattling the chain l fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unruffled) Hey, Jesse James.  Don't you remember me, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings the gate open and offers an open hand to the do sniffs the hand suspiciously, then wags his tail. That a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, motioning to Neil to bring the car through.  Ne to the driver's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil pulls the car in and stops at the mouth of the maze. Thompson secures the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson gets back in on the passenger side.  Neil is sud playing chauffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  It's deep in the heart of this place.  Take it slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil eases on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy closes the door and turns to the kids.  They look t waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, straight talk only in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Kristen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't get to her.  I've tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dims the lights and goes to the pendulum device. I was hoping we'd have more time to  learn how to use the dreams... (beat) But Joey's in there.  And Kristen's  going in with or without us.  They need us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean we're gonna try to go in with her?  To link up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's now or never.  I won't kid you. This is as dangerous as it gets.  If you die in the dream, it's for real. Nobody has to go in that doesn't want to.

dialogues.speaker: THE KIDS
dialogues.text: A long silence.  Their faces reflect conflicting emotions dread, anticipation.  Then, quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go kick that motherfucker's ass all over dreamland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face reflects the same emotions -- but mostly, there in the kids.  She turns the pendulum on and sits with the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now remember -- whatever happens, stay together.  That's the only way we can  beat him.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: Staring intensely at the pendulum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Clear your minds...of everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson's car pulls slowly around a tight corner and sto amounts to a small clearing deep in the labyrinth of stac autos. Thompson and Neil get out, the weak headlights of teh old illminating the towering heaps of rusted metal surroundin Thompson peers around, then points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  The Caddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rear end of a ravaged 59 Cadillac sticks out from ben huge stack of automotive carcasses, its rusted tailfins j like the spines of some prehistoric beast. Neil crosses to the car and runs his hands over the corro surface of the trunk.  He tries to lift it, but it's lock

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: stands beside the Dodge.  He takes a swig from a pint bot glances around into the darkness nervously.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: finds a large four-pronged tire iron -- three ends for lu the other end a sharp wedge.  He jams it under teh trunk applies pressure.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: observing nervously.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: leans his head closer to the trunk as he strains against iron.

dialogues.speaker: THE LOCK
dialogues.text: explodes in a cloud of rust.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Gazing in.  PAN TO an ancient, crusty burlap sack lying i shadows of the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson silently eases behind the wheel of his Dodge, ca to draw Neil's attention.  he's going to get the hell out here         -- -- but there are no keys in the ignition.  Thompson looks glaring at Neil through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil holds up Thompson's keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I showed you where the goddamn thing was. I didn't say I'd stick around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil tosses Thompson a shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about to attend a funeral.  One that's long overdue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and the kids are staring at the pendulum, faces sla Nancy's voice is a soft hush.  They are being lulled into dream state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture yourselves in the Quiet Room... the soft white walls...the total  silence...just the sound of your  hearts beating.  Picture yourself there...with Kristen. (beat) I'm going to count backwards from five. And when I'm done, we'll all be  asleep...we'll all be in the Quiet Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen is slumped in a corner, face against the wall, to incoherent now.  There is no more fight left in her.  She fading...fading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bare whisper) Nancy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five...

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Four...

dialogues.speaker: TARYN
dialogues.text: Three...

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: Two...

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen's eyes flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and the others are now in the Wuiet Room with Krist Kristen looks around, crying and happy that her friends a She hugs them in turn -- a sweet, teary reunion. I knew you'd come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't think we'd let you go alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fuckin' way.  We're a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey needs us.  I can feel him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we find him, Kristen?

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL
dialogues.text: Four huge razors slash through the canvas -- RIIIIIIP!  C padding flies.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: reacts as teh razors vanish -- then RIP from the wall dir behind them.  Everyone moves to the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happens, stay together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton padding billows through the air as the razors slas the wall again and again -- from in front, from behind, f side, from the floor, from everywhere. The Quiet room becomes a white void of ripping and slashi vicious blizzard of whirling padding.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: The blades lash out from the billowing clouds of cotton. forced back.

dialogues.speaker: TARYN
dialogues.text: screams as the blades flash by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shielding her eyes) HOLD HANDS!  FIND EACH OTHER!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Screaming, panicking, spun around in the blizzard.  Lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCY!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: The blizzard of cotton padding dissipates and slowly vani Kristen looks up a dream. ANGLE WIDENS SLOWLY OUT to reveal Kristen sitting at her table in her bedroom at home.  The crude paper mache Elm House model is in front of her, still under construction. Zevon's "I'll Sleep When I'm Dead" still blares from the Nothing has changed.  She's still home.  Safe.  She wonde of it, everything, has been nothing but a bad dream. Her mother enters, dressed in the same beautiful evening snaps the radio off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you'll wake the whole neighborhood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bleary-eyed) Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you still doing up?  It's past  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd wait for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched) Well, I'm home now, so you can go right to sleep.  C'mon, angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns down teh covers.  Kristen crawls onto the bed a her arms around Elaine's neck in a spontaneous hug. What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just glad you're home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine gives her a kiss and tucks her in.  She goes to te and reaches for the lightswitch. Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pauses in doorway) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had such an awful dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN'S VOICE comes from downstairs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine?  Where do you keep the bourbon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right down. (to Kristen) Kris, I've got a guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk?  Just for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't it wait till morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Mom?  I just don't want to be  alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Elaine is violently yanked out the door, reveal

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: framed in the doorway, wearing immaculate formal wear, sc at Elaine (she's off camera).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BITCH!  I SAID WHERE'S THE FUCKING  BOURBON!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sweeps his razors down at her.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: SCREMING in bed.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: Grinning insanely, he leans into the room, holding Elaine decapitated head up for Kristen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should listen to your mother, Kristen.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE'S HEAD
dialogues.text: Dangling in Freddy's grasp, blood dripping from the neck, jabbers at Kristen in a glassy-eyed harangue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaddamn it Kristen, you always ruin everything!  Every time I have a man  over you spoil it!  You know what  your shrink said!  You're only trying to get attention!

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: screaming and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: drops the head and lunges at her, claws swiping the air.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: rolls out of bed as Freddy's claws tear her pillow open i explosion of feathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen turns and runs, Freddy right on her heels,  his f blades mere inches from her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen's momentum takes her right up the wall -- she pus in an incredible gymnast's flip, hurtling up in an arc ba Freddy's head -- Freddy hits the wall, his finger-razors deep in the plaster.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: makes a perfect landing near her bed and snatches up her  bedspread.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: howls with rags and yanks his razors from the wall in an of plaster.  he whirls and dives at Kristen -- -- as she flings the bedspread over him.  He tangles up, down hard, thrashing to get free.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: hurtles herself out the window in an explosion of glass.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: Ripping and slashing,  he wrestles the bedspread off and away in tatters.  He looks aroudn, howling with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen EXPLODES through a skylight in the living room ce drops to teh floor in a rain of glass.  Bruised and batte rises to her feet and looks around.  Lost.  Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Nancy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whirling cotton fills the screen...dissipating to reveal her full dream warrior splendor, platinum crest of hair  shimmering.  She finds herself in a twisting hallway in t dreamscape -- and hears KRISTEN'S FAINT CALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Kristen?  Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries up a passageway and turns a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy leaps from the darkness, blades flashing. Taryn nimbly dodges and whirls, producing two large gravi knives.  She click-clacks them open, twirling them expert

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay asshole.  Let's dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy gives her an evil smile and squares off against he They circle each otehr slowly...then Freddy lashes out. Taryn ducks and cuts deeply across Freddy's ribs. Freddy SCREAMS with anger and swipes twice more, ripping gouges in Taryn's shoulder. Taryn draws back, keeping her guard up.  She feints, then out, slashing Freddy again. This time Freddy draws back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taryn...why should we fight?  You and I are old friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taryn stands poised, ready for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) Let's get high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his hands into frame -- his fingerhave all turn oversized hypodermic neeles, their needle-sharp tips glit the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: TARYN
dialogues.text: Revolted by teh weird display.  She looks down, feeling s strange.

dialogues.speaker: TARYN'S ARMS
dialogues.text: Her needle track scars are expanding and contracting like sucking mouths...hungry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The instant her guard is down, Freddy lunges at her and b both sets of hypodermic fingers into her arms, pinning he wall.  Taryn SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: HYPO FINGERS
dialogues.text: As their inner plunges depress, Taryn's biceps swell grot veins bulging impossibly.

dialogues.speaker: TARYN
dialogues.text: We can actually see the high-pressure fluid travel upward veins and body balloon, racing from her arms -- her neck temples expand -- eyeballs bulge -- Then the top of her head literally explodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING WITH Will -- he holds a torch high in one hand, a the other.  He looks like a thin pirate out of a Dungeons Dragons game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Hello?  You guys, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heas a SOUND somewhere in the darkness ahead.  He  pauses...nothing.  Suddenly, there's a SOUND OF SCREECHIN and a strange object comes racing out of the darkness at lunges out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: THE OBJECT
dialogues.text: screeches to a halt and wheels about.  It's an oversiezed nightmarish version of Will's wheelchair -- made of rusty metal and bristling with spikes and hooks.  To sit in it agonizing death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look tired, Will.  Have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will whirls about to see Freddy leaning nonchalantly agai pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken) No thanks.  I'm fine just the way I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now.  But when you wake up... (singing) ...you're back in the saddle again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is visibly upset by this -- and reacts too slowly as wheelchair bears down on him again.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: is sideswiped and knocked to the ground, his leg bleeding

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAIR
dialogues.text: spins around, preparing for another run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the chair for you, kid.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAIR
dialogues.text: The wheels smoke, burning rubber as it launches itself at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, to himself) I'm the Dungeonmaster...the Dungeonmaster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will suddenly levitates to his feet.  A wizard's robe swi him as crackling electricity plays across his fingertips, like the illustration on the Dungeonmaster game card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheelchair ROARS over camera.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Green lightning explodes from his fingertips and shatters wheelchair into fragments.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: reacts in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: looks up at Freddy, grinning with his newfound power.  Th lights emanating from his fingers cast a weird glow acros face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the name of Elric, Prince of Elves -- demon begone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will rushes at Freddy, shooting wizard's fire.  The crack green energy engulfs Freddy completely -- -- but Freddy grabs Will by the front of his shirt and li off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy snarls into Will's face as the living energy twine him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry kid.  I don't believe in fairy  tales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy buries his claws in Will's chest -- the blades poi out of Will's back as his death cry ECHOES down teh halls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen wanders through the twisting distorted hallways o dreamscape.  She hears Will's SCREAM echo and fade away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELLO?  ANYBODY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faint, faraway) Kristen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns a corner and sees Nancy at the end of a hallway Nancy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush toward each other -- but stop as they hear a st CRUNCHING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND comes again -- a horrible CRACKING AND SNAPPING wall begins to spiderweb with cracks as it bulges outward Something big seems to be trying to press through to cut from each other.  Nancy and Kristen back away warily. Suddenly, there is an EXPLOSION of wood and plaster -- an steps through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) Yo.  I thought I heard voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Kristen yell with delight.  Kristen throws her around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid!  I could kiss you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's stopping you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen is taken aback for a moment -- then gives him a c sincere kiss on the mouth.  He grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.  So where's Joey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  It's like a maze in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's time to stop guessin' and start messin'. (hollering) FREDDY!  WHERE YOU HIDING, YOU PUSSY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid -- we should find the others first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU'RE HOT STIT WITH A LITTLE MUTE KID -- LET'S SEE YOU TAKE A PIECE OF ME! (silence) KRUEGER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no response. (muttering) I knew he was chickensh--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the lights around them flinker and dim.  They h DEEP, REVERBERATING GROAN OF METAL.  All look over the ra

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE SHOULDER
dialogues.text: as they peer downward.  Where before there was nothing, t now two huge, rusty boiler room doors slowly swinging ope the entrance to Hell.  Orange light flickers from below.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: Still finishing his prior statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- shhhiiiiit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tree slowly descend teh stairs, all bravado lost.  Th before the immense gate.  Within lies flickering darkness twisting steps leading down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.  Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's snuff the fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy, Kristen, and Kincaid cautiously come down the wind stairs and pass under an arch way made of twisted, scorch tricycles and shattered dolls. They exchange worried looks, then step through.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER
dialogues.text: A surrealistic boiler room, air red with heat and haze. Freddy sits on a throne made of children's skulls and bon Joey is nearby, suspended over the pit of flames like a w altar. Welcome to Freddy Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low gutteral chuckle) Look Joey...all the little piggies have come home.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: He turns his terrified, pleading eyes toward his friends. skin is hot and blistered.  The tongues that lash his han feet to the four posts are writhing slowly, licking his a wrists.  He opens his mouth in a mute, silent scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Joey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go.

dialogues.speaker: THE THRONE
dialogues.text: Freddy sweeps his hands, the obedient servant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wish is my command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a gesture.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: The tongue/creature securing his left wrist unravels -- h precariously.  The other tongues begin to loosen their ho

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: lunges to the edge of the pit, reaching for Joey.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: laughs maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: THE PIT
dialogues.text: The last tongues give way and Joey drops -- -- just as Nancy snatches his wrist and hangs on.  Kincai Nancy by the belt and hauls them both back out.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: With a cry, she runs and does a double flip over the burn pit -- right at Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: THE THRONE
dialogues.text: Kristen snap-kicks right into Freddy's face, toppling him throne backwards.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: strains as he rips a six-foot section of pipe from the wa races toward the throne.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: helps Joey to his feet just as a tongue/creature flies ou darkness and whips around her neck, strangling her.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: rises from the rubble of his throne and lashes at Kristen flips over his head -- but Freddy backhands her, sending spinning across the room.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Clutching one end of the writhing tongue, she forces it t ground.  She grabs a furnace poker and skewers the creatu instantly unravels from her neck.

dialogues.speaker: THE FALLEN THRONE
dialogues.text: As Freddy prepares to slash Kristen, Kincaid races in, sw his pipe in a wide arc.  It smashes across Freddy's back, him to his knees. Kincaid raises the pipe for a second blow, but Freddy lea with a ROAR and grabs Kincaid, hauling him high over his Nancy rushes in just as Freddy's arms are extended and pl poker into his heart. Everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: looks down at the poker with an exaggerated gasp -- then grin at Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: reacts in horror.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: releases Kincaid's feet and holds him dangling by the thr With his free hand, he pulls the poker slowly from his ch looks at the tip -- it glistens with dark, rancid gore. it like an ice cream cone.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY AND KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Kristen rises, using Nancy for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too strong!  He was never this strong!

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: whirls to her, Kincaid still choking in his upraised fist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hissing) Yesss!  The souls of the children...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rips his shirt open, revealing his hideously scarred b ...they make me stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His flesh begins to undulate and swell.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON FREDDY'S TORSO
dialogues.text: Rippling blisters appear, forming into faces -- horrible, faces wailing in despair.  We recognize Phillip ... Jenni Will ... Taryn ...

dialogues.speaker: NANCY AND KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Total horror and revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: An insane, gleeful grin -- and a gutteral whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always room for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The burlap sack is lifted out.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON BURLAP SACK
dialogues.text: as neil drops it beside a freshly dug grave.  Freddy's bo clatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy flinches in pain -- he looks up in fear, suddenly that somebody's disturved his bones.  His fear is slowly by an evil, cunning grin. He vanishes -- Kincaid finds himself struggling and choki mid-air.  He drops to the ground, gasping for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thompson crawls from the shallow grave and throws the sho aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell good is this supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignoring him, Neil picks up the tire iron and holds it up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will be our headstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jams the tire iron into the ground at the foot of the It looks like a cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hears something) What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil now hears the FAINT SOUND OF ROCK MUSIC on the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody else is out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We're alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another song snaps to life -- closer to them.  The Rollin "Sympathy for the Devil."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see Neil and Thompson through the cracked windshie rusted-out Chevy.  The radio suddenly lights up, blaring rock song.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL AND THOMPSON
dialogues.text: More MUSIC comes from all around them, blasting from teh long-dead autos, a cacophony of rock songs from the 50's We hear the HOWLING of Wolfman Jack.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARS
dialogues.text: Broken headlights sputter to life.  A windshield wiper ne Thompson slaps madly back and forth across shattered glas honk.  An exposed fan blade WHIRRS like a buzzsaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse whisper) The whole place is coming to life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men turn to look at the burlap sack.  There is a sli stirring from within. Neil hurries over and grabs the sack to throw it into the

dialogues.speaker: THE SACK
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a skeletal hand wearing finger-razors tears thr rotted burlap and latches onto Neil's wrist. The sack rips wide open as Freddy's charred bones leap in life -- a hideous shambling skeleton SCREAMING with unear rage.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: Frozen  to the spot.  Can't believe his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: falls back, scrambling away as Freddy's blades slash the inches in front of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Jesse the junkyard dog hurtles out of the darkn the hellish thing's back, biting and snapping. The skeleton pulls the dog from its back, slashes its thr one quick motion, and tosses the carcass aside.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: Something snaps in him as he glares at the skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really you.

dialogues.speaker: SKELETON
dialogues.text: It turns and grins hideously at Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: THOMPSON
dialogues.text: grabs a piece of pipe and rushes the monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send you back to Hell here you belong!

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: meets Thompson's rush head on, blocking the pipe and yank off his feet. It hurls Thompson through the air with incredible force.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Thompson slams into it, impaled on the tail fin.  He look the metal point jutting from his chest...and dies.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: grabs the shovel and swings it -- the skeleton ducks and Neil's ribs, ripping his shirt wide open. As Neil doubles over, the skeleton rips the shovel from h and smashes it solidly against his head.  Before Neil can the creature straightens him up with a second vicious blo hear BONE CRACK.  Neil falls back into the grave. The skeleton shrieks with unholy laughter and begins to s loose dirt onto Neil. It tosses the shovel aside, raises its arms into the air victorious HOWL -- and collapses into a pile of bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy, Kristen, Kincaid, and Joey exit the boiler room, l battered, and bloody.  They face the weird perspectives o Street halls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen, can you pull us out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sedated me.  We're stuck here till it wears off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start down a corridor and enter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie mannikins and an ornate three-way mirror stand in t shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there's activity in the mirror.  A wavering lig Freddy materializes.  An infinity of Freddies are reflect three-way mirror behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to keep you waiting.  Perhaps if there were more of me to spread around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy runs into the room, magically followed by rows of mirror reflections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!  He's multiplying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is suddenly filled with dozens of Freddies slash chasing our heroes.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: leaps over a wicker basket to escape a Freddy.  As a seco lunges, she jams a knitting needle through its throat.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: springs over a group of Freddies, catches a wall fixture, flips across the room.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: With a battle cry, he plows into the charging Freddies, b them over.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: cringes back, cowering behind the mannikins.

dialogues.speaker: THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: More Freddies pouring into the room.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: is backed into a corner, torn with slash marks.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: delivering flying kicks, but slowing down.  A Freddy grab from behind, holding her for the others.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: goes down under the sheer weight of Freddies crawling all him, slashing.  There are jsut too many.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: steps out from behind teh mannikins, shaking with emotion friends are overwhelmed -- none of them can last more tha seconds longer.  He opens his mouth and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An incridible, deafening, universe-shaking cry.  Joey has his dream power.

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE-WAY MIRROR
dialogues.text: is blown into fragments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the Freddies EXPLODING into shards of hurtling glass Kristen, and Kincaied cover their ears.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: finally stops.  Total silence.  He looks just as surprise everyone else at what he's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Wow. (does a double take at his own voice) Did I say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure as shit did!  You saved our asses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone!  We got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid scoops Joey into his arms in a crushing bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, put me down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON the open grave.  A bloody, dirt-encrusted hand g edge of teh grave.  A second hand follows.  Neil Goldman painfully pulls himself out of the grave. He has an ugly wound on the side of his head and his coll broken -- but he's alive. Gasping with pain, Neil crawls to the pile of Freddy's re With tremendous effort, he pushes hte bones over the edge grave.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVE
dialogues.text: The bones tumble into the earthen pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen helps Nancy to her feet as she brushes away the s glass of the Freddies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace tearfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) It's over.  It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy turns and sees her father floating toward her, glow golden nimbus of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy? I've crossed over, Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crossed over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I couldn't go until I told you how sorry I am for all the things I've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy gazes at him, slowly comprehending. I love you so much.  I'll always love you.  Goodbye, Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy goes to embrace ehr father one final time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll always love you, Dadd --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her words are cut short as her body jerks violently.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT
dialogues.text: "Thompson" is wearing Freddy's glove -- the razors buried Nancy's stomach.

dialogues.speaker: NANCY
dialogues.text: Her eyes wide and staring as she realizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) No.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY/THOMPSON
dialogues.text: As Thompson's face disappears and is replaced by Freddy's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jams the blades in deeper.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP ON Neil -- using his one good hand, he grasps the of holy water and uncorks it with his teeth.  He presses forehead and closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse whisper) Please God.  For the children.  For Nancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at Freddy's remains. Ashes to ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks a stream of holy water onto the bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy, still locked in an embrace with Nancy as she dies as a pattern of holes rip across his body -- bright shaft light burst through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust to dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks a second stream of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another arc of holes explode across Freddy's body.  He ar back, SHRIEKING -- -- and Nancy slides of his blades.  Kristen runs to her.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Neil holds the crucifix.  He leans down and presses it ag skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay this spirit to rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cross-shaped hole explodes from Freddy's forehead -- br blinding white light pours out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Freddy staggers back, riddled with glowing holes, we s whrilwind of spirit faces pouring from him -- sould of hi soaring out, freed at last.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID AND JOEY
dialogues.text: Awestruck as they watch.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: The holes expand, eating Freddy alive as his SCREAM ECHOE the dreamscape. The shafts of light from his body merge into one white ho then EXPLODES. Freddy is gone.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: cradles Nancy in her arms.  nancy is drifting toward deat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) He's gone.  It's over.  Please don't die, Nancy.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak) I'm so proud of you all. (pause) Tell Neil I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sags against Kristen.  Kristen shakes her head, tears brimming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you die.  i won't. (lower, strange intensity) I'm going to dream you... (whispering in Nancy's ear) I'm going to dream you into a beautiful dream.  Forever and ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes and holds Nancy tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three caskets are surrounded by a large number of MOURNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen, Joey, and Kincaid watch tearfully.  Neil, wearin brace, puts his arm around the kids as the caskets are lo

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: He notices movement on the hilltop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nun stands on the crest of the hill.  She turns and w away, disappearing from view.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: leaves the funeral and starts up the hillside after her.

dialogues.speaker: HILLTOP
dialogues.text: As neil reaches the tree where he first met the nun, he c glimpse of her as she dissappears behind a crypt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister...wait.

dialogues.speaker: THE CRYPT
dialogues.text: Neil rounds the crypt -- the nun has vanished. Only a simple tombstone stands at this edge of the field. Neil steps closer.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOMBSTONE
dialogues.text: The inscription reads: Here Lies Amanda Krueger Her name in Christ, Sister Mary Helena. Born 1907 - Died 1968

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) My God.  You were his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seasons have changed.  A blanket of freshly fallen sn the house.  A VW Rabbit with New York plates is parked in driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen and Neil have finished a meal together and are si wine.  Her hair is shorter.  Neil looks thinner, a little

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad things have worked out for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think new York was just what I  needed.  So many people.  I never feel alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) The city that never sleeps. (pause) So what will you do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I'm busy with school. New friends. (beat) But I'll never forget the old ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises his glass) To old friends.  And your new dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To old friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil is at the door, seeing Kristen off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was great seeing you again.  I'm glad you dropped by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pauses at her car) Do you still...see each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strange little smile) Yes.  I'm going to see her tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen nods.  She knew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you say hi? (he smiles that he will) Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil closes the door.  He's alone in the empty house.  He out the lights and trudges slowly upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil in bed, drifting off to sleep.  The tight, weary loo from his face -- he looks peaceful, contented. PAN TO the paper mache model of the Elm Street House.  It different now -- clean and pure and inviting.  A lovely l place, in fact.
